intro: Seseli athamantha, commonly known as the Greek seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a slender, upright stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. Seseli athamantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
